sentences.sContent: They tried to scramble up the cliff.
The village was a 20-minute scramble away.
sentences.sCn: 村子离这里有20分钟的攀登路程。

synos.tran: 攀登；使混杂，仓促凑成；扰乱
抢夺，争夺；混乱，混乱的一团；爬行，攀登
爬行，攀登；不规则地生长；仓促行动

remMethod.val: scr(看作scream， 尖叫) ＋ amble(看作able， 能…的) → 攀岩时听到尖叫也不能乱作一团 → 攀登； 搞乱

words.tran: 爬行者；[电子] 扰频器；周率扰乱器
争夺；攀登；搅拌（scramble的过去分词）

trans.tranOther: to climb up, down, or over something quickly and with difficulty, especially using your hands to help you
a difficult climb in which you have to use your hands to help you
